title: Practice Challenge
description:
Create a simple access control system for a secure building:
1. Create variables: isEmployee (boolean), hasKeycard (boolean), securityLevel (number 1-3)
2. Access is granted if:
   - Person is an employee AND has a keycard
   - OR security level is 3 (admin access)
3. Display 'Access Granted' or 'Access Denied'
instructions:
Create a simple access control system for a secure building:
1. Create variables: isEmployee (boolean), hasKeycard (boolean), securityLevel (number 1-3)
2. Access is granted if:
   - Person is an employee AND has a keycard
   - OR security level is 3 (admin access)
3. Display 'Access Granted' or 'Access Denied'

testCases.description: Grants access for employee with keycard

hints.text: Use parentheses to group: if ((isEmployee && hasKeycard) || securityLevel === 3)

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Using 'and' or 'or' instead of symbols:
   if (age > 18 and hasLicense)  // WRONG
   if (age > 18 && hasLicense)   // CORRECT

commonMistakes.consequence: This can lead to errors or unexpected behavior.
commonMistakes.correction:
Confusing && and ||:
   if (isWeekend || hasWork)  // Do I work on weekends or any day?
   vs
   if (isWeekend && !hasWork) // Free weekend?
   Read them out loud to check!
